title: Arise, My Soul, Arise

author.name: Charles Wesley
author.bio: Charles Wesley was an English leader of the Methodist movement, most widely known for writing about 6,500 hymns.

lyrics:
Arise, my soul, arise
Shake off thy guilty fears;
The bleeding sacrifice
In my behalf appears,
Before the throne
My surety stands;
My name is written on
His hands.

He ever lives above,
For me to intercede,
His all-redeeming love,
His precious blood to plead;
His blood atoned
For all our race,
And sprinkles now
The throne of grace.

Five bleeding wounds He bears,
Received on Calvary;
They pour effectual prayers,
They strongly plead for me:
"Forgive him, oh, forgive," they cry,
"Nor let that ransomed
Sinner die."

My God is reconciled;
His pardoning voice I hear:
He owns me for His child;
I can no longer fear:
With confidence I now draw nigh,
And "Father, Abba Father," cry.
